Welcome to Molecular Graph Theory's documentation!¶

class core.BuildMG(filename: str, ressep=3, splitMgt=None, segid=None)¶

Base class for loading Coupling strength dataframe.

Creates a new BuildMG instance.

Parameters:
  • filename -- Name of the file to be loaded
  • ressep -- residue separation( >= I,I + ressep), default is I,I+3

:type int :param splitMgt: split mgt into BB or BS or SS :type str :param segid: segment id to analyze, if not mentioned all segid is used :type str

load_table() → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Load Coupling Strength DataFrame :param verbose: verbosity :return: Structured coupling strength DataFrame

mgt_mat(segid=None, ressep=None)¶

Build MGT Matrix

Parameters:
  • segid -- input segment id
  • ressep -- input residue separation
  • segsplit -- True: split matrix based on segids(ie. if 2 segids present, list of 2 dataframes are returned) False: A single matrix with inter- & intra- segement interactions is returned
Returns:

MGT dataframe
sepres(table: object = None, ressep: object = None) → object¶
Parameters:
  • table -- table for sequence separation
  • ressep -- sequence separation to include (eg. >= I,I + ressep), default is I,I+3)
Returns:

DataFrame after separation
splitSS(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame = None, write: bool = False, prefix: str = None) → tuple¶

Split based on secondary structures. BB - Backbone-Backbone Interactions BS - Backbone-Sidechain Interactions SS - Sidechain-Sidehain Interactions

Parameters:
  • df -- Dataframe to split. If None, df initialized during class instance is taken
  • write -- write after splitting
  • prefix -- prefix for writing file
Returns:

tuple of split DataFrames
sum_mean(table=None, segid=None, ressep=None)¶

Returns the sum, mean and standard deviation of residues based on the self.grouping

Parameters:
  • table -- DataFrame to sum
  • segid -- segment id
  • ressep -- Number of residues separation
Returns:

list of DataFrames [sum, mean, stand deviation]
